traceability.evidence:
Multiple CLI tests verify the standardized exit codes: - test/cli.upToDate.test.js asserts exitCode 0 when all dependencies are up to date - test/cli.outdated.mock.test.js and test/cli.outdated.test.js assert exitCode 1 when safe updates exist - test/cli.check-mode.test.js covers exitCode 0 and 1 in --check mode across table, JSON, and XML formats, and exitCode 2 on errors - test/cli.error-cmd.test.js and test/cli.invalid-options.test.js assert exitCode 2 for invalid JSON output, npm errors, and unknown/invalid flags
In the CLI implementation (bin/dry-aged-deps.js), errors invoke handleError → process.exit(2), and successful runs use process.exit(summary.safeUpdates>0?1:0) consistently. The README documents exit codes in the “Exit Codes” section, and the help text includes the --check flag behavior.
traceability.notes: All acceptance criteria and requirements for story 012.0 (exit codes 0, 1, 2; consistency across formats; error handling; test coverage; documentation) are fully implemented and verified by tests. Backward compatibility is preserved.
